page.title: 07ROYAL HUNTING.
page.content:
= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =} { { Moor Ridding}is located to the South of Bridgnorth. The building has been there since 1211. {King Henry viii}used to fish and hunt there.On the{23rd October}every year at the Law courts of London,they still carry on the medievil custom of {handing over the faggots of wood}from Moor Riddings to the Corporation of the{City of London. The faggots of wood are first chopped with a blunt 'bill hook',which won't chop them through. Then a hatchet is taken, which cuts them through with its first blow.The Ceremony is conducted by the Queen's Remembrance.
* * * * * * * * * * * * * *
